jrtr.glrenderer

Class VRRenderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.glrenderer.VRRenderContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderContext

    public class VRRenderContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderContext
    This class implements a RenderContext (a renderer) using OpenGL version 3 (or later).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int activeShaderID
      The id of the currently active shader (you should always useuseShader(GLShader) and useDefaultShader() to switch between the shaders!).
      private GLShader defaultShader
      The default shader for this render context, will be used for items that do not have their own shader.
      private com.jogamp.opengl.GL3 gl 
      private VRRenderPanel renderPanel 
      private SceneManagerInterface sceneManager 
      private Texture_t texType 
      protected FrameBuffer vrBuffer
      The buffer containing the data that is passed to the HMD.
      private static VR_IVRCompositor_FnTable vrcompositorFunctions

      • VRRenderContext

        public VRRenderContext(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        This constructor is called by GLRenderPanel.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the OpenGL rendering context. All OpenGL calls are directed to this object.

    • Method Detail

      • setOpenVR

        public void setOpenVR(VR_IVRCompositor_FnTable _vrcompositorFunctions,
                      VRRenderPanel renderPanel)

      • resize

        public void resize(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)

      • setSceneManager

        public void setSceneManager(SceneManagerInterface sceneManager)
        Set the scene manager. The scene manager contains the 3D scene that will be rendered. The scene includes geometry as well as the camera and viewing frustum.
        Specified by:
        setSceneManager in interface RenderContext

      • display

        public void display(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        This method is called by the GLRenderPanel to redraw the 3D scene. The method traverses the scene using the scene manager and passes each object to the rendering method.

      • beginFrame

        private void beginFrame()
        This method is called at the beginning of each frame, i.e., before scene drawing starts.

      • endFrame

        private void endFrame()
        This method is called at the end of each frame, i.e., after scene drawing is complete.

      • draw

        private void draw(RenderItem renderItem)
        The main rendering method.
        Parameters:
        renderItem - the object that needs to be drawn

      • initArrayBuffer

        private void initArrayBuffer(GLVertexData data)
        A utility method to load vertex data into an OpenGL "vertex array object" (VAO) for efficient rendering.
        Parameters:
        data - reference to the vertex data to be loaded into a VAO

      • setTransformation

        private void setTransformation(javax.vecmath.Matrix4f transformation)

      • setMaterial

        private void setMaterial(Material m)
        Pass the material properties to OpenGL, including textures and shaders. Implementation here is incomplete. It's just for demonstration purposes.

      • cleanMaterial

        private void cleanMaterial(Material m)
        Disable a material. To be implemented in the "Textures and Shading" project.
